sen.j: 石川年足（いしかわ の としたり、持統天皇2年（688年） - 天平宝字6年（762年）9月は飛鳥時代末期から奈良時代中期の貴族。
sen.e: ISHIKAWA no Toshitari (688 - October 762) was a noble who lived from the end of the Asuka period to the middle of the Nara period.
ISHIKAWA no Toshitari (688 - October 762) was a noble who lived from the end of the Asuka period to the middle of the Nara period.
ISHIKAWA no Toshitari (688 - October 762) was a noble who lived from the end of the Asuka period to the middle of the Nara period.

sen.j: 壬申の乱以降蘇我氏の嫡流となった少納言蘇我安麻呂の孫、参議石川石足の子。
sen.e: He was a grandson of a Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) SOGA no Yasumaro, who became the head of the Soga clan after the Jinshin Rebellion, and was a son of a Sangi (councillor) ISHIKAWA no Iwatari.
He was a grandson of a Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) SOGA no Yasumaro, who became the head of the Soga clan after the Jinshin War, and was a son of a Sangi (councillor) ISHIKAWA no Iwatari.
sen.cmt: 統一事項に基づき、Jinshin Rebellion→Jinshin Warに修正
sen.e: He was a grandson of a Shonagon (lesser councilor of state) SOGA no Yasumaro, who became the head of the Soga clan after the Jinshin War, and was a son of a Sangi (councillor) ISHIKAWA no Iwatari.
He was at the Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and was a Gyoshi-taifu, which was an equivalent position to Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 御史大夫についての説明を追加しました。
sen.e: He was at the Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and was a Gyoshi-taifu, an equivalent position to Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
He was at the Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and was a Gyoshi-taifu, an equivalent position to Dainagon (chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 父石足は年足が40歳を越えるまで健在であったが、初叙はかなり遅く、石足の死後である、47歳の時だった。
sen.e: Although his father Iwatari had been alive until Toshitari became more then 40 years old, his first investiture was very late: it was finally taken place when he was 47 years old, and it was after Iwatari's death.

Although his father Iwatari had been alive until Toshitari became more then 40 years old, his first investiture was very late: it was finally taken place when he was 47 years old, and it was after Iwatari's death.

Although his father Iwatari had been alive until Toshitari became more then 40 years old, his first investiture was very late: it was finally taken place when he was 47 years old, and it was after Iwatari's death.

sen.j: しかし、その後は行政能力などで優れた手腕を発揮し、特に739年には出雲国国司としての善政を聖武天皇に讃えられ、あしぎぬや麻布等を与えられている。
sen.e: Subsequently, however, he showed his excellent skill in politics, and in 739, he was granted thick silk fabric and linen by Emperor Shomu in praise of his good government as a kokushi (provincial governor) of Izumo Province.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し「特に739年には出雲国国司として…」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Subsequently, however, he showed his excellent skill in politics, and in 739, he was granted thick silk fabric and linen by Emperor Shomu in praise of his good government as a kokushi (provincial governor) of Izumo Province.

Subsequently, however, he showed his excellent skill in politics, and in 739, he was granted thick silk fabric and linen by Emperor Shomu in praise of his good government as a kokushi (provincial governor) of Izumo Province.

sen.j: この時、藤原四兄弟はそろって天然痘により死没しており、藤原氏の権勢は一時後退していた。
sen.e: Around that time, the influence of the Fujiwara clan was temporarily becoming weaker because four Fujiwara brothers died one after another due to smallpox.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around that time, the influence of the Fujiwara clan was temporarily becoming weaker because four Fujiwara brothers died one after another due to smallpox.
Around that time, the influence of the Fujiwara clan was temporarily becoming weaker because four Fujiwara brothers died one after another due to smallpox.

sen.j: しかし父石足と特に親しかった藤原武智麻呂の次男、藤原仲麻呂が台頭すると、彼の又従兄弟にあたる年足もその権勢にあずかる事となる。
sen.e: However, once FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, the second son of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, who was a close friend of Toshitari's father Iwatari, became powerful, Toshitari could also enjoy Nakamaro's patronage because Toshitari was a second cousin of Nakamaro.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, once FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, the second son of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, who was a close friend of Toshitari's father Iwatari, became powerful, Toshitari could also enjoy Nakamaro's patronage because Toshitari was a second cousin of Nakamaro.

However, once FUJIWARA no Nakamaro, the second son of FUJIWARA no Muchimaro, who was a close friend of Toshitari's father Iwatari, became powerful, Toshitari could also enjoy Nakamaro's patronage because Toshitari was a second cousin of Nakamaro.

sen.j: かくして、749年に紫微中台が設置されると、その次官（大弼）として仲麻呂の補佐にあたり、その直後にはすでに61歳になってはいたが、参議として公卿に列せられる。
sen.e: When the Shibi Chudai (the office handled the principal Empress Komyo's affairs) was established in 749, he started to support Nakamaro as a daihitsu (undersecretary), and shortly after that, he was ennobled as a Sangi (councilor) although he was already 61 years old.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し「749年に紫微中台が設置されると…」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: When the Shibi Chudai (the office handled the principal Empress Komyo's affairs) was established in 749, he started to support Nakamaro as a daihitsu (undersecretary), and shortly after that, he was ennobled as a Sangi (councilor) although he was already 61 years old.

When the Shibi Chudai (the office handled the principal Empress Komyo's affairs) was established in 749, he started to support Nakamaro as a daihitsu (undersecretary), and shortly after that, he was ennobled as a Sangi (councilor) although he was already 61 years old.

sen.j: 756年には元興寺へ派遣される。
sen.e: He was dispatched to Gango-ji Temple in 756.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し「756年には元興寺へ派遣される。」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was dispatched to Gango-ji Temple in 756.
He was dispatched to Gango-ji Temple in 756.

sen.j: 757年から759年にかけては養老律令の施行・官職名の変更・別式20巻の編集（施行はされず）等に貢献し、その功もあってか、758年には70歳という高齢ながら、御史大夫（大納言）に任ぜられた。
sen.e: From 757 through 759, he contributed to the enforcement of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code, the change of official post names, and the compilation of 20 volumes of Bessiki (operational regulations of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code), which was not enforced in fact, and he was appointed as a Gyoshi-taifu (or Dainagon) in recognition of his great work in 758 in spite of his great age of 70.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し、冒頭は「757年から759年にかけては…」、また後半部分「758年には70歳という高齢ながら、…」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: From 757 through 759, he contributed to the enforcement of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code, the change of official post names, and the compilation of 20 volumes of Bessiki (operational regulations of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code), which was not enforced in fact, and he was appointed as a Gyoshi-taifu (or Dainagon) in recognition of his great work in 758 in spite of his great age of 70.

From 757 through 759, he contributed to the enforcement of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code, the change of official post names, and the compilation of 20 volumes of Bessiki (operational regulations of the Yoro Ritsuryo Code), which was not enforced in fact, and he was appointed as a Gyoshi-taifu (or Dainagon) in recognition of his great work in 758 in spite of his great age of 70.

sen.j: これは祖父・安麻呂以降の蘇我氏（石川氏）出身者としては最も高い官位であったが、直後の光明皇后の崩御、孝謙上皇の病を直した道鏡の台頭等仲麻呂の権勢に陰りが見え始めてきた762年に74歳の生涯を閉じた。
sen.e: This was the highest official rank among members from the Soga (or Ishikawa) clan after his grandfather Yasumaro, and he finally ended his life at the age of 74 in 762, when a dark sign began to be seen in the influence of Nakamaro due to Empress Komyo's death, which occurred shortly after Toshitari's taking office, and the rise of Dokyo, a priest who healed Retired Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し、文末「762年に74歳の生涯を閉じた。」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: This was the highest official rank among members from the Soga (or Ishikawa) clan after his grandfather Yasumaro, and he finally ended his life at the age of 74 in 762, when a dark sign began to be seen in the influence of Nakamaro due to Empress Komyo's death, which occurred shortly after Toshitari's taking office, and the rise of Dokyo, a priest who healed the Retired Empress Koken.
sen.cmt: 女帝のため、Retired Emperor Koken→the Retired Empress Kokenとしました。原文に年号を補いました。(trans1 コメント参照)
sen.e: This was the highest official rank among members from the Soga (or Ishikawa) clan after his grandfather Yasumaro, and he finally ended his life at the age of 74 in 762, when a dark sign began to be seen in the influence of Nakamaro due to Empress Komyo's death, which occurred shortly after Toshitari's taking office, and the rise of Dokyo, a priest who healed the Retired Empress Koken.

sen.j: その死に際しては「卒性廉勤にして、治体に習ひ家を興し、少判事に補す」、「公務の間、ただ書を見ることを悦ふ」と評された。
sen.e: People appreciated his personality and said, 'He was honest and diligence, and was granted a post called Shohanji because of a great achievement as a governor and the head of the family,' and 'He was happy as long as he could read books while on duty,' after his death.

People appreciated his personality and said, 'He was honest and diligence, and was granted a post called Shohanji because of a great achievement as a governor and the head of the family,' and 'He was happy as long as he could read books while on duty,' after his death.

People appreciated his personality and said, 'He was honest and diligence, and was granted a post called Shohanji because of a great achievement as a governor and the head of the family,' and 'He was happy as long as he could read books while on duty,' after his death.

sen.j: 死後1000年以上経った1820年には摂津国より墓誌が発見され、現在国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: In 1820, his epitaph was discovered in Settsu Province more than 1,000 years after his death, and it is now designated as a National Treasure.
sen.cmt: 原文に年号が抜けておりましたので、ウェブを確認し、「1820年には摂津国より墓誌が発見され…」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: In 1820, his epitaph was discovered in Settsu Province more than 1,000 years after his death, and it is now designated as a National Treasure.
In 1820, his epitaph was discovered in Settsu Province more than 1,000 years after his death, and it is now designated as a National Treasure.

sen.j: また、万葉集にも年足作の和歌が1首残っている。
sen.e: Additionally, Manyoshu (The Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) includes one Japanese poem composed by Toshitari.
Additionally, Manyoshu (The Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) includes one Japanese poem composed by Toshitari.
Additionally, Manyoshu (The Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) includes one Japanese poem composed by Toshitari.

sen.j: 11月7日、国分寺建立の検地監督。
sen.e: November 7: He conducted a land survey for provincial monastery construction.

sen.e: September 28, 753: He was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and appointed as the Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu office).
